page.title: 09Our Farm.
page.content: Our farm is very small; we only have 75 acres. My father and grandfather are the only ones who work on the farm. We have 25 acres of crops and 50 acres of grass. At the moment we have 196 lambs and 300 sheep. We also have 10,000 turkeys kept in two huge poultry houses. The farmhouse in which my family lives used to be an inn and is about 450 years old. The stage coaches were kept in what is now the farmyard. Nearly every year my sister and I have to bottle feed some lambs because the mother has not enough milk for them all. We rear the turkeys for a firm called Butterball. They bring them to us when they have just been hatched and fetch them again when they are very big.
